data.title: Aishwarya Rai’s Exit from Bachchan Home Fuels Divorce Speculations
data.meta_description: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's exit from Bachchan Housse sparks divorce buzz – Is It The End for Bollywood's Power Couple?
data.text:
The marital dynamics of Bollywood’s beloved power couple, Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai, are once again under public scrutiny. Recent reports suggest that Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and her daughter, Aaradhya, have allegedly moved out of the Bachchan residence, ‘Jalsa.’ Speculation gained momentum when Abhishek Bachchan was seen without his wedding ring, sparking rumors of a potential separation.

Sources close to the celebrity duo have clarified that the couple has not contemplated ending their relationship. Instead, they emphasize that their primary concern is their daughter, stating, “It is for their child that Abhishek and Aishwarya are still together. They have been facing challenges for years, and now the situation has reached a critical point.”

The reports suggest that ongoing issues within the Bachchan family reached a critical juncture when Bachchan’s daughter, Shweta, moved into ‘Jalsa,’ further complicating matters for Aishwarya Rai. Despite the family turmoil, all members gathered to support the acting debut of Agastya Nanda, Abhishek Bachchan’s nephew, at ‘The Archies’ premiere. However, an underlying uneasiness prevailed among them, reflecting the complexity of the family dynamics.

Read More: Wonka” Debuts Strong Amidst Musical Challenges

Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan, married since April 20, 2007, have been enduring persistent rumors of family troubles. The latest reports indicate that Aishwarya has moved out of the Bachchan house.

According to sources close to the couple, their togetherness is primarily for the sake of their daughter, Aaradhya. The source acknowledges the long-standing challenges in their marriage, stating, “It is for their child that Abhishek and Aishwarya are still together. They have been having problems for years, and now matters have come to a head.”
